text: Sampled from tap at Craftbeer Corner Coeln. Pitch black with an off-white head. Sweetish-malty, moderately roasty and slightly resiny aroma of dark chocolate, coffee and some pine. Slightly sweetish, malty, rather roasty and slightly resiny taste of dark chocolate, lots of coffee, some licorice and hints of pine, followed by a medium long, rather dry-bitter and slightly resiny finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice, although less hoppy than the name suggests.

From 330ml bottle. Pours with huge light tan small bubbled head with great retention. Aroma of roast, american hops, and dark berries. Flavour of deep roastiness, hints of coffee, oak, dark fruit, subtle hint of booze. Lingering taste of roast malt and dark chocolate that lingers a little too long. Decent lacing. Quite oily. A good sipping beer

Pours dark brown from the bottle and leaves a brown, frothy head. Aroma goes at first into chocolate, then the hops come through and remind very much of an IPA  pine and grapefruit being evident. Taste is bittersweet but with the bitter component gaining the upper hand. Medium bodied, very dry, with a feel in the mouth of wet cotton. Makes you thirsty. Overall though, not bad. Certainly not a traditional porter, and feels throughout much more like a black IPA.
Fresh from the tap at Muted Horn. Fine roasty notes in the nose. Roasty mouth, but at least light watery.
jakiś rześki ten porter, jak czarna bryza, bardzo ciekawe, osobne piwo

Aroma: maltas tostadas, café, lúpulo floral, hierba. Aspecto: negro, medio, cremoso, cabeza amarillenta. Sabor: ligero amargo. Boca: intensidad de amargos, lúpulo floral, malta tostada, hierba, acabado seco. En general: gran Porter, muy lupulada en aroma y paladar

Bottle 33 best before 30.12.17. Aspect : noire à belle mousse beige. Arômes : sur le fruit notamment les agrumes, le résineux, le caramel brûlé, le chocolat, le café (mais pas si évident), la réglisse ... que sais-je encore ? Saveurs : entrée en bouche bien fraîche puis les malts rôtis se développent en compagnie des houblons ce qui donne : chocolat, citron, café, ... et une belle amertume tout au long. Terrific Porter ! Not far from a Black IPA !

Bottle 330ml. (Citra) Deep brown with a dense beige head. Aroma of roasted malts and dryish coffee notes. Palate is very smooth and creamy - top notch! Taste is dry with hints of the hops but plenty of malts, even somewhat smoky.
Black, beige head. Lots of coffee aroma. Some hops. Taste is more coffee and a dry hoppy feeling. Roasted malts, good mouthfeel for only 5,7%. Brilliant.

Tap @ale&hop, Barcelona. 
Aroma is coffee and lightly hoppy, quite fresh. Pours black with a beautiful long lasting brown head. Taste is coffee, bitter in the middle and finishes with a long lasting smooth dark chocolate taste. Medium carbonation and medium body. Just an insane brew, one of the best porter I tried.

Aroma: coffee, roasted dark malts, nuts.
Appearance: deep brown color and creamy head.
Taste: roasted dark malts, coffee, ashy, nuts, roasted caramel, medium herbal bitterness, pine, rather dry. 
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Outstanding beer, complex and tasty, must try.

Bottle from The Kernel Brewery, Bermonsdey, London (UK). Brown colour with a little of beige head. Aroma is toffee, roasted malts and something herbal. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate. Medium body and chocolate in the finish.
Tap at MultiQlti. Herbal aroma, only hint of choclate and roasted notes. Roasted sunflower, chocolate, some coffee. Medium body, velvet, smooth.

Bottle. Pours black with a thin tan head that resides in an ice cream foam. Scent is light notes of roasted malt. Taste is consistent although stronger. Finish is quite dry and raspy. About 60-70 IBU but without much point. Good.

Piana drobna, ładnie zdobi szkło. Aromat przyjemny, intensywny. Jest ten słynny prażony słonecznik, sporo palonych słodów. Na początku chmiele wydawały mi się raczej żywiczne w odczuciu, przy zamieszaniu okazało się jednak, że to bardzo przyjemny cytrus. Później chmielowy aromat nieco się rozwiewa. Dość wysoko wysycone. Mocno palona podstawa słodowa towarzyszy bardzo wyraźnym nutom cytrusowym. Znacznie bardziej owocowe niż w aromacie. Grejpfrutowa goryczka, nieco spalenizny przy posmaku. Całość sprawa wrażenie lekko przypalonego na grillu cytrusa. Bardzo dobre piwo.

(on tap)
Aroma:coffee,biscuits,chocolate,slighlty earthy.
Appearance:close to black color,dense beige head.
Taste:semi-sweet,falvour of chcolate,nutts and coffee,dry roasty and ashy aftertaste.
Palate:low to medium body,low to medium carbonation.
Overall:Well-made,tasty coffee-oriented porter.

Bottle, 6.4%, hops: galaxy, chinook, exp431.
Pitch black, with a nice creamy brown head, staying and a bit lacing.
Aroma is "wow!": coffee, roasted malt, and the hops, amazing, resin.
Then the taste is surprisingly different, the roasted malts are the most evident note, coffee again, chocolate, the resin hops are still there but more if in the aroma they are the main note, in the taste they are more on the background. Medium-low carbonation, oily texture, bitter finish.
Great beer.

Bardzo ładny wygląd, brązowa drobnopęcherzowa piana i czarna barwa piwa. Aromat przyjemny, chmielowy, mocno kawowy, do tego gorzka czekolada. W smaku podobnie. Intensywna chmielowość, mimo tego bardziej wyrazista jest kawa, przyjemna, bardzo długo utrzymująca się na języku. Kremowa faktura. Amerykańskie odmiany chmielu wnoszą ciekawe nuty do piwa, nieco przypomina Black IPA, jednak wciąż dominuje porterowy charakter. Bardzo udane piwo, świetny balans

Draught. Pitch black with a mostly lasting coffee brown thin foamy head. Aroma is of dark chocolate, coffee, grassy, nuts, biscuits. Taste is of dark chocolate, coffee, biscuits, caramel, citrus, grassy, bitter finish. Oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

500ml bottle, hops: Bramling Cross, Centennial. 5.9%. Pours jet black with a large tan head. Aroma is hoppy, earthy, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee. Taste of piney hops, some dark fruit, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Long bitter finish. Creamy texture, medium bodied, soft carbonation.
Really good cocoa and coffee aroma, great mouthfeel for its abv, nice bitter finish
Klares, sehr dunkles Braun mit reichlich Schaum. Röstmalzig, dunkle Schokolade, Kakao, etwas Vanille, Kaffee, leicht fruchtig, etwas Grapefuit, leicht bitter.
Bottle.Black with a small head,aroma of pine hops coffee and dark malt,taste is earthy,rich and hoppy with dark choc tobacco wood and malt,long hoppy grapefruit leather bitter finish.
Bottle, from minutemat (thanks!). Dark brown, amber highlights, beige head. Big piney green hop character with full bodied roast. This could easily qualify as a black IPA! Really tasty.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 330 ml bottle from Theatre of WIne, hopped with Chinook. Pours black with a fine, brown, lasting head, lacing present. Very nice aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and plums. Taste starts off hoppy, dried plums, middle is chocolate, finish is long, bitter, lasting coffee. Oily texture, medium-bodied, lasting bitterness. Great porter.

Keg Third of a Pint at BrewDog, Clerkenwell, London in Jan 2016 - Opaque Black in colour. Good creamy beige head. Good lacing. Very Malty; deep roasty malts, coffee, espresso, dark chocolate. Fruity; dark fruits. Quite spicy. Hoppy; good hop bitterness. Great depth of flavour. Bittersweet roast coffee chocolate malty and spicy fruity throughout. Terrific Porter! (2016-01-16)

Bottle. Sensoric. Dark brown with medium, semi-thick, light brown head. Good head retention and moderate lacing. Moderately malty aroma - roasted, caramel, chocolate, coffee. Moderate hoppy aroma - mainly citrus (orange, grapefruit), slightly piney. Taste is moderately bitter and moderately sweet, quite hoppy. The bitterness lasts for quite a long time ends up with some grassy and ashy notes. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, finish is bitter, grapefruit, roasted, slightly chocolate and earthy. Summary: Taste and aroma are acceptable, nothing really outstanding. The good thing is quite diverse aroma as for the porter. Still slightly dusty, but in overall very good brew.

Pours a dark viscous cola brown with a light head. Hop-forward nose and indeed hop-forward tongue. Theres a nice coffee-chocolate oily malty bitterness underneath but its drowned out by the extremely assertive hops. Hoppy finish as well!

Dark brown, opaque.

Aroma: oily citrusy hops, grassy hops, light bitter chocolate.
Dry and bitter.
Flavour: grapefruit peel, spicy herbs, bitter chocolate, raw cocoa.

Very good.

Black colored, medium tan creamy lasting head. Aroma is of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and some floral hops. Taste is medium sweet malt, dark chocolate, roasted malt and coffee, medium roasty bitterness, some earthy and floral hops, dry roasty finish, bit burnt. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy.
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Szybko opadająca, drobnopęcherzykowa piana, utrzymuje się cieńką warstewką do końca picia, ładnie oblepiając szkło.
W zapachu pierwsze rzucają się amerykańskie chmiele, zaraz potem paloność, czekolada, skórka chlebowa.
W smaku chmielowe mango, w tle lekka kwaskowatość, paloność 
Nasycenie nie za wysokie, bardzo przyjemne.

Very black with a nice mocha head which remains for a long time. Aroma has some dark malts but is dominated by hops. I estimate mosaic, there is that unique mosaic aroma of spicy/herbal earthiness. Flavour is similar. Medium body, dark malts give a chocolatey and coffee-like base. Beer is very hoppy, herbal/earthy. Has a delicious long finish with resiny, herbal hoppiness and dry chocolate. Wow. Awesome beer.

Bottle (from the Bierkoning,NL): Almost black,medium-sized and stable creamy and lacy tanned head; moderate to solid bitter-sweet nose of roasted malt, dried fruits, cacao&vanilla plus spicy hops in the background; almost solid bitter-sweet flavour with delicate sourish traces, medium bodied , soft to silky MF; lingering drier roasty and chocolatey finish with an increasing bitterness in the aftertaste. A very nice Porter...

Pours dark brown with medium head. Aroma: nice hops aroma, in particular some herbs, roasted sunflower seeds, plus roasted malt. Taste: roasted malt, again tons of hops reminding me of herbs, some coffee and chocolate. Very good.
Roasted notes, coffee, chocolate, practically black with a good tan head, medium body, too carbonated for me, again cholate than the hoppy profile with citrus...good beer.

330ml bottle, thanks to my wife. 6% ABV, Mosaic hops. Almost black, an inch of light tan head. Rich chocolate aroma with some brown sugar, peaches and light tropical fruit, hint of pine. Any fear than Mosaic isnt going to work here allayed. Lightish bodied, carbonation is a little on the high side. Mocha in the background providing richness but not much sweetness. A bit of licorice. Firm bitterness than builds out of the malt side of things and leaves nice fruit flavours lingering along with modest roasted ones.

330 mml bottle as part of the European Local Swap, many thanks Minutemat. Tasted on the 16/11/2016. Almost pour black colour with a medium beige head. Aroma of hops, black coffee and roasted malts. Taste is intense coffee, cocoa powder and some liquorice. Next one please!

sample.bottle. czarne, niewielka ilość drobnopęcherzykowej piany, utrzymującej się w postaci drobnej obrączki do końca picia. w aromacie karmel, czekolada, kawa. w smaku wyraźna goryczka, ale również kwaskowość od słodów palonych. dobre nasycenie, super pijalne, nasycenie w punkt.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, coffee, fruits
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Ein Weltkasse Porter!!!! Wenn man denn auf Verhopfungen steht. Aber der Reihe nach. Optisch perfekt, die leicht bräunliche Schaumkrone ist gut haltbar und wirkt schön cremig. Der Sud selbst ist undurchsichtig schwarz und nur am Glasrand schimmert es wollüstig dunkelrot. Mmmmhhhhhh. Pfeffriger Röstrotfruchtalarm vom Allerfeinsten. Üppig. Das Näschen freuts. Leider hält der Trunk den geweckten Erwartungen nicht ganz stand, was allerdings Kritik auf höchsten Niveau ist, denn der strotzt trotzdem vor lauter schlanken portertypischen Röstflavours, inklusive der bereits erwähnten Hopfenkraft des großen Hr.Centennial. Die Bittere hält sich im mittleren Intensitätbereich auf und driftet hin und wieder ins Säuerliche ab. Toll. 0,33/Ca. 4. Flasche. BEYOND BEER HH. Im Nachhall kommt sogar noch eine ledrige Wilderness durch.....Yippie!!! Und auch BIPA Verweise finden, nicht unerwartet, statt. Coole Socke, das gute Stück.
Scurissima, quasi nera. Laroma trova riscontro nel gusto con forti note di caffè, malti torrefatti e frutta rossa. Buona!!!

Bottle from Beersnmore. A smooth porter with a focus and drinkability and balance. As such, the dark malts are pleasantly simple but decent (chocolate, some nuts, a bit toasted, hints of ripe dark fruit), the body medium with support of a soft carbonation and a light bitterness. Aroma hops are notable on the palate. Very round. Great beer.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 33cl bottled 03/2016 - shared at bastardas Post-Baltikum tasting Sep 2016, terviseks! - Some Grand Manier fumes hovering over a rich and satisfying Viennese coffee aroma, cocoa powder and earthy Jaffa cakes. Dry, hoppy with fragrant orange peel bitters and resins, quenching the roasted malt sugars, ending on some char and bitter chocolate. Luscious pillowy smooth and suave mouthfeel. // rerate 33cl bb09/2016, fluffy, roast, lovely bitters. Holds up well overtime.

Bottle from Deeside drinks emporium. Pours a jet black with a toffee coloured head. Aromas of cold pressed coffee, wood smoke and a slight bitterness. Flavour is again coffee with bitter dark chocolate and burnt crusty bread. Lovely porter.

W nosie średnio intensywnie, kawa, czekolada, pumpernikiel, w tle leciutkie tropiki. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste, piana beżowa, wysoka, gęsta. W smaku dość wytrawne, mnóstwo kawy i wytrawnej czekolady, na dalszym planie czarna porzeczka i lekki cytrus. Świetna kompozycja, amerykańskie chmielenie subtelnie uzupełnia klasyczny styl portera. Podsumowując takie portery to ja mogę codziennie. Chmiele: chinook, centennial, simcoe. Butelka do 21.12.2016

33 cl bottle, 5,8% ABV. This one is with Amarillo, Chinook & Sticklebract hops. Black with beige/brown head that stays afloat a long time. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, dark fruits, plum, a bit of citrus, earthy. Light sweet, a heavy dry bitterness comes kicking in after a while, and that lingers out slow slow in your whole mouth, ie a long finish. Pretty light body, thin creamy texture with lively carbonation. Lovely porter with no apparent flaws, one of the best ive tried.

Bottle from the brewery. Mosaic hopped. Pours black with a big beige head. Nice coffee aroma with some hoppy pine coming through. The taste has nice gentle pine to start with before lots of coffee and chocolate pudding comes through. Theres a touch of spice and some biscuit too. Very tasty.

Barwa cemnobrunatna, piana beżowa, drobnopęcherzykowa. Aromat bardzo bogaty: kawa, czekolada, prażone słody, orzechy. W smaku również przede wszystkim ciemna czekolada, kawa i prażoność. Odczucie w smaku bardzo kremowe, ciało średnie w stronę wysokiego. Nuty zapachowe i smakowe bardzo wyraźne.
33cl @home , zwart/bruin met dikke blijvend schuimkraag. Koffie en chocolade smaken . Goed in balans . Lekkere Porter  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

500ml bottle (6%) at home, from Good Spirits Company, West Nile Street, Glasgow (bb 9 Jun 2017) (Mosaic hops), cocoa, chocolate, roast malt aroma, near black with a good tan head, grassy, coffee, smokey, bitter, harsh, lasting bitter hop finish.
Tap at Brewdog, Shepherds Bush. 26/08/16. Slight aroma, a hint of malt. Deep black. Fine beige head. Mesium bodied. Creamy in to the finish. Not too bitter. Dark choc. Roast. Lovely jubbley.

Bottle thx to Leighton. Pours dark brown with espresso head. Aroma is chlorine, plastic, paint thinner, muff cabbage, licorice, grass, pete, smoke, pine. Flavor is smoke, pine, light chemicals, grass, earth, cocoa. Medium body, malty and bitter... Nice!

500ml bottle from Brewdog shop. 
Small tan head, great lacing. Dark near black body. Creamy coffee nose, a bit nutty. Light coffee flavour, roasted nuts, cocoa, light grassy bitterness on the aftertaste. Light carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Really good porter.

Great dark appearance with brown head. Aroma of citrus and piney american hops but supplemented by dark malty notes, cocoa like melanoidines. This is a quiet hoppy brown porter which still remains an english porter with additional hoppiness. Very pleasant, bitterness is great and still it is a sessionable beer.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2016 Dark roast, bay leave. Hard to say what the hops do in such a dark beer. Not because there?s bit there, it?s awesome, but it?s the mix together that makes the brew. (33cl bottle from Etre Gourmet)Earlier Rating: 9/30/2013 Total Score: 4Chocolate milk, full rich malts, solid hop backup. Smooth, bitter, dark, clean, rich. Its all in there. Really good. (Bottle shared at th Borefts 2013 afterparty)

37-my Porter na świecie. 
 Chmiele:  Chinook, Columbus 
 Data butelkowania:  24.02.2016 
 Data ważności:  24.02.2017 
 Kolor:  Na pierwszy rzut oka wydaję się czarny. Patrząc jednak pod światło widać, że w rzeczywistości jest to ciemny brąz. 
 Piana:  Betonowa wręcz, bujna kremowo-beżowa góra!
Piana jest hiper-drobna, jak na azocie.
Tworzy ona jedną zbitą warstwę.
Lacing jest wręcz niebywały. Fale Dunaju, a raczej Tamizy w pełnej okazałości.
Doskonała, wysoka obrączka na górze piwa, niczym pianka na Cappuccino. 
 Zapach:  Klasyka gatunku. Intensywna czekoladowa słodycz, wzbogacona o melasę i odrobinę słodowej, chlebowej bazy.
Na zapleczu kawa z mlekiem. 
W oddali lekka paloność.
Mam wrażenie, że co jakiś czas przewija się nutka żywicy - to prawdopodobnie sprawka Chinooka. 
Jest także delikatna ziołowa woń. 
 Smak:  W smaku nie jest już tak klasycznie jak na Portera przystało, ale to nawet lepiej. Jest oryginalnie.
Na pierwszy plan wysuwa się tutaj nuta lasu iglastego. Sosnowe, żywiczne nuty przyjemnie wibrują na języku.
Dopiero po chwili do głosu dochodzi stylowa czekoladowość, która zdecydowanie oscyluje w kręgach gorzkiej czekolady. Kawowa wytrawność objawia się na ostatniej prostej.
Jest także silna nuta włoskich orzechów z charakterystycznym cierpkim posmakiem w ustach.
Goryczka średnio intensywna. Posmak kawy z odrobiną gorzkiej czekolady długo utrzymuje się w ustach. Finał jest długi, kremowy. Słodycz pięknie równoważy się z wytrawną kawą i orzechami.
Wysoka pijalność i aksamitność na języku - to najważniejsze cechy Porteru. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie.
 Podsumowanie:  

Klasyk, czy nie klasyk? Oto jest pytanie?
Otóż nie klasyk, ale za to wybitnie dobry Porter. Nie klasyk z pewnością przez silne żywiczne, leśne i iglaste akcenty, nieczęsto przecież spotykane w Porterach. Zarówno Chinook, jak i Columbus wnoszą takie cechy do piwa. 

Jest to zdecydowanie American Porter z mocniejszym alkoholen niż w wersjach z Wysp Brytyjskich. Bardziej nachmielonym z akcentami kawy, czekolady, orzechów i lekką palonością.

Kremowa, wspaniała aksamitna tekstura. Wysoka pijalność i gładkość odbioru.
Czy można chcieć czegoś więcej?
Keg tap east 6 per cent. Looks better as it progresses, which is unusual. Great tasting - nothing too dominant. Drinkable Thames water.
A harmonious beer dark brown tan head pine chocolate heading into bipa territory rich mouthfeel moreish.

Coffee & dark chocolate nose. A mouth full of feel - bitter, chocolate malt contrasted with a good dose of piney & limey bittering hops. This is an immensely beautiful beer.

Rated by BrewTom
On tap at OConnors Uppsala. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Smells and tastes coffee, salty, roasted malt with a clear bitter finish.
Black colored beer with a small beige head. Taste is koffie, chocolade, nice hoppy taste, citrus and fruity. Good bitternes.

BOTTLE 50 CL at 5,6%, Chinook Columbus. Pitch black, dark beige creamy head with good retention. Aroma has smooth lightly sweetened chocolate, and quite a bit of grassy, citrus and even rosebud hops. The taste is just as smooth, dark chocolate with a sweet filling. The hops adds a fruity almost desert-like quality to the chocolate, as well as crisp dry bitter finish. Maybe a bit too resiny. Super smooth and velvety mouth-feel. Excellent.

Bottle shared by will run for beer bottle date of 2 December 2015. He hand carried back from England. Aroma is chocolate, earthy grain, pine hops. Flavor follows with a sturdy amount of bitterness to balance out the chocolate and earthy malts. Body is medium with a dry, herbal texture. Nice

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer dated 12/2/15 black pour with a one finger creamy coffee head. Aromas of roasted malt ash hint of earthy hops. Taste is smooth roasty malt molasses and a balanced bitter finish.

500ml bottle picked up at BottleDog Kings Cross. Bottled 02 Dec 15. Pours dark brown with a big beige head. Earthy aroma of unsweet chocolate and dark coffee. Flavor is milk chocolate, coffee. Pine bitterness in the finish.

7.5cl sample at the Ghent Beer Festival VI (22 VIII 2015). A stout looking ale with brown cassonade coloured foam on top. A roasted coffee and bitterness are omnipresent. The Indian-styled hopping is very mild. Not a true black IPA, but yet a subtly hopped porter with lots of dark, coffee and chocolate bitterness. Lovely ending.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Jet black with a thick dark brown head of foam. It has a very rich oak, liquorice, chocolate and tropical fruit flavour with a bitter smoked chocolate and pine on the finish. Excellent!Earlier Rating: 5/10/2013 Total Score: 4.3Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This beer is thick, inky black with a rapidly disappearing tan head. It has very strong orange marmalade and tropical fruit flavours with chocolate and slight roasted coffee on the creamy finish. Superb!
Lovely coffeeish sipper. Quite deep for such low ABV. Nice roast level, coffee, dark choco, noticeable citrussy, floral hops. Well balanced, enjoyable brew, tho I would like more muscled version
Dark brown with foam ring. Dusty coffee and roasty nose. Very dusty roasty and with some coffee. Quite porterish. Little spicy aftertaste. Good porter.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 Chinook / Centennial / Mosaic. Bottle at home. Aroma is roasted malt, lots of milk chocolate, fruity hops, tropical fruit and citrus notes, coffee. Flavour is light sweet and moderate to medium roasty hoppy bitter. Body is medium and a bit creamy. Almost a Black IPA, lovely roast and milk chocolate. Delicious. / Chinook. Bottle from Slijterij Groningen. Again, lovely roast and fruity hops combination. Smooth and rich, great.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2016 Aspecto de porter densa y oscura con espuma beige. Aroma de black IPA, muchas notas de pino, resina y fruta además chocolate, caramelo y grano tostado. En boca es bastante amarga, sigue dominando la sensación de una black IPA, bien de pino y café. Textura sedosa muy lograda.

Pours very dark with tan head, aroma of pine, coffee, toast, leafy and slight leather. Medium sweet and bitter, complex and lingering taste. Light carbonation providing just enough kick to bring everything through. Thin though slightly oily texture. A fantastic Porter!
Milky and roasted and hazelnuts mby some peanuts. Great taste balance with minor sour kick.
Bottle shared at Aarons. Not a fresh bottle, but still very tasty and still with a presence of hops. Chocolate. Medium mouthfeel. Good.
Svart med høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter humleblomst, mørk sjokolade og salt lakris. Smaker kakaobønner, mørk sjokolade og noe salt lakris. Kort. Kakao og salt sitter igjen.

Keg at Kufle i Kapsle. Black with beige head. Aroma of cocoa, roasted malts, vanille. Taste follows the aroma, yet with coffee and a hint of oranges. Full body and oily texture. Soft carbonation and good lace. Very good beer.
Bottle, Tasting @ Chez Alain, Rennes. Hoppy leafy and roasted, cocoa. Moderate sweetness, bitter finish. Soft carbonation. Watery to oily.

At Maakuns. Shared bottle. Sweet roasted chocolate malts. Fruity hops, light oranges, vanilla, chocolate. Light sweet, light bitter. Very smooth velvety mouthfeel. Bit watery body, very light carbonation. Very nice but prefer these flavors on a heavier body.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Almost black with quite big fluffy light brown head that leaves lots of lacing. Lots of citrus hops up front with lime and a little bit of lemon. Lychee, cocoa powder, light coffee notes, some grass and chalk, toffee, brown bread. Light sweet and under medium bitter. Almost medium bodied with fine sparkling carbonation. Nice.

Bottle from Beergium. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, hops, espresso, nuts, a bit of chocolate and dark fruits. Bitter finish with roasted malts, espresso, hops, nuts and dark fruits. Exquisite porter.

In bottiglia. Colore bruno impenetrabile con fioco riflesso rosso, molto scuro. Meravigliosa testa, alta e soapy, da beige a marrone chiaro, di buona persistenza, piccante e amara. Intenso naso maltato, dolce e mediamente speziato, caratterizzato anche da note di lievito. Carbonazione soffice e leggermente fitta. Superlativo aroma dolce di malto scuro, terroso e speziato, parzialmente tostato con qualche picco leggermente piccante, caffelatte decisamente scorrevole irrobustito con un po cioccolato, liquirizia, qualche nota di caramello secco e speziato. Gusto inizialmente dolce e lattico, poi frizzante e amaro da medio a pieno, con picchi di rabarbaro. Finale setoso, di lievito e fine malto tendente ad una secchezza incompleta. La maltatura è davvero intrigante e complessa. Corpo medio con alcool nascosto molto bene, ma comunque presente nel corso della beva. Trama da lattica a croccante. Dopo beva lattico che lascia le fauci gradevolmente umide. Pours a black color, with a medium, brown head.

Drinks outstandingly smooth with a lower carbonation, featuring a dough creaminess.

Bouteille de 330ml. Superbe bière noire avec une mousse crémeuse brune et qui accompagne le dégustateur tout au long du parcours. Le nez est super houblonnée, cest agréable. Il y a aussi bien sur cest un porter des notes de grains rôtis et de du chocolat. La levure lui confère un côté fruité fort sympathique. En bouche le liquide est crémeux, ce qui veut dire que la texture est quasi huileuse. Il y encore du chocolat, des fruits et des houblons. Lamertume est équilibré. Un succès. 8/10 version à 6,5% alc. meilleure avant le 01.03.2013

Une bouteille de 33 cl qui porte une date:  01.03.13.  Un liquide qui présente une robe brune très foncée et une mousse beige très généreuse et solide.  Un nez de malts torréfiés et de gâteau au chocolat amer.  Des saveurs de café arabica et de caramel brûlé.  Des couches chocolatées comme des strates qui appartiennent au bonheur.  Une bouche de moyenne dimension et un mouvement fort des bulles.  Une agréable texture crémeuse.  Un arrière-goût interminable sur des malts profondément noircis.  Un porter savoureux.

Dark brown, almost black with a generous brownish head that leaves a good lace. Very nice cakey nose with caramel dominating. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation that suits this beer very nicely, smooth caramel mocha flavors. The hops are present but never upfront. This bottle is probably at least a year old and goes down with a lot of pleasure. Only down side, the aftertaste is a bit short. Must be beautiful in its youth. Loved it.
Bottle at cask and kitchen, London . Dark black pour. Roasty aroma with fresh resiny hops. Great flavors: solid roast, sticky hops. Both feed off each other without dominating the beer. Very nice
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2015 Dark reddish brown with a small tan head. Malty with fruity notes. Malt, fruit, roasted and coffee. Medium body with along, bitter finish.

Pours black with a lovely tan head that stays a while.
Nice and smooth, has a bitterness to it that youd normally associate with a stout I think. Liquorice, bitter dark chocolate, fairly dry with a fair amount of hops on the finish.
Had this on draught and Im fairly certain the ABV was 6% - or at least it was marked up on the display as 6%.
Very good, not what I was expecting.

My Bottom Line :  
Dark chocolate and toasted bread converge on this Porters cherry-like hints before green hop bitterness and molasses undertones complete a compelling picture. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A sheet of foam tops the blackness with dark brown edges.
-Carbonation is quite fluffy, building a pillowy mouthfeel.
-Roastiness hits you at first, but the malts complexity is slowly, but surely, unveiled.
-That is one attractive nose.

Bottle.

(Bottle, 5.8%). Pours decent brown head, persisting well. Opaque, dark, muddy brown. Mid carb. Musky, spicy hop aroma; a bit cannabis-like and some sharp pine, some tropical fruit, and lots of dark, roasted malt aroma, with a bit of coffee. Nice, but the muskiness is a bit off-putting. Taste - Quite bitter, with dry, strongly roasty malts (ashy espresso), followed by quite a lot of spicy and fruity hop flavours and pine, which clear the palate to an extent. Theres a lingering bitter, ashy aftertaste, which is a bit unpleasant; not enough sweeter malt lingering to balance it out. Some nice resiny hop tastes when you burp though :P 
Medium body, slightly oily and astringent finish.
Overall, nice, with some pleasant and slightly unusual flavours and packing a big taste punch for 5.8%, but its a bit too dry and bitter for me, which means that i had to drop the taste and overall scores a bit.

50cl bottle at the brewery. Pours a dark brown color, no light shines through. Head is big and creamy with beige small bubbles. Quite lasting and sticking on the glass. Aroma is a hops show on a roasted malt base: pineapple, mango, nuts, roast. Awsome. Taste is bitter with definite espresso notes and a hint of acidity. Roasted malts and nuts as well. Little sweetness and bitter ending. Body is silky with soft carbonation. Overall, lots of different flavors hold up nicely together for a fantastic product.

50 cl. bottle shared / thx to ajax25g  dark brown going to black with a sizable brown head, smells like mocha, chocolate & clinical hops (pine resin), taste is sweet chocolate upfront, toffee, mocha, fruits, quickly turning into bitter pine resin hop blast, sharp citrus, coffee, quite lovely, full / soft carb

14/IV/2012 - 500ml bottle @ home - BB: 25/XI/12 (2012-367) Thanks to ajax25g for sharing the bottle!
Very dark brown beer, creamy beige head, adhesive, little stable. Aroma: very confusing, exotic fruits, mocha, piny resin, coffee, pineapple. MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: fruity start, mocha, pineapple, citrus, coffee. Aftertaste: mocha, coffee, piny, little sweet, some caramel. Pretty original, pretty good!

0.5l bottle from beermerchants.com Really slowly gushing out the bottle this one pours a dark muddy-brown body with a nice little creamy chocolate head. The aroma has sweet roasted, hoppy and some ashy tones. A little bit of chocolate in this one as well. Its average carbonated and the mouthfeel is oily to thin-oily. Really smooth flavors with roasted malts, plenty of stingy hops, cold coffee and definitely a good dash of chocolatepaper. Lots and lots of flavor in this one, and its ending with a suiting hint of ashes and a little hot chili-like tone both in the finish and aftertaste. Quite tasty indeed, perhaps a bit of lack in the body at first, but all in all a really nice india black ale. Great with a spicy pizza! 18.03.2012

Bottle at home. Black pour, huge foamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, citrus hops, bready yeast, caramel, chocolate and coffee. Flavor is bitter floral roasted goodness. Quite full bodied for the amount of alcohol. Very drinkable and well balanced brew.

500 ml bottle courtesy of Hugh. Pours very dark brown with a creamy brownish gray head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of lacing and trace on the glass. Smell is tiny sweet, bitter and tiny sour with roasted malts, orange peal, coffee, pine, freshly cut grass and hints of lemon juice, bitter chocolate and rubber. Taste is very bitter and tiny sour with roasted malts, lemon zest, orange peal, coffee, grass and resinous wood. Mouthfeel is dry, tiny tart and medium bodied. finish is dry and bitter with coffee, pine and lemon juice.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2012 Bottled.  A black beer with a large rocky whitish head.  The bottle did gush a bit on opening.  Over carbonated.  Very roasty and bitter porter.  Licorice notes.  Very bitter fruits.  The nose is restrained but the head doesnt help there.  A bit one dimensional and surprisingly thin on the finish.  There are citrussy hops which help provide a bit of character but this doesnt totally work.  Score 3.5Subsequent rating also scored 3.5

Bottled. The aroma has milk chocolate, cacao, hint of vanilla. Dark brown-black coloured beer with a medium, beige head. The taste is bitter and this clean bitterness lingers. It has chocolate, some citric fruitiness. Dry mouthfeel, little carbonation. Very nice.
#1369 draught; Nose Is rye, stale coffee, some moldy malt, weak iron, feel is quite broad, carb Is mediumheavy, taste Is cork, leather, sour earth, then cream, milk chocolate

Fad:Sort øl med stort skumhoved. Der var en smule problemer med skænkningen. Men da øllen først var kommet i glasset kan jeg forstå hvorfor folk taler om Kernel. Rigtig solid baseøl af porter med en god sødme, bakket op af en god humling af primært amerikansk type. En del citrus. Rigtig fin øl.
Brought a bottle of this one to a tasting. Dark brown colour with no head. Smells coffee, roasty and ash. Tastes sweet, coffee, chocolate and roasty. Bit thin palate, long aftertaste, good carbo.

Bottled, 500ml from Merton Beer Fest 12. Deep black with brown head, lovely pour. The first thing to notice is the aroma on opening the bottle, smelt like a mixture of rat pee and tar, but its not about the aroma, this then went into a black morass of liquorice, dark roasted malts and pitch, lying heavily on the palate, may not sound good but tasted great. There is a hop trying to escape through, couldnt quite describe it, but it was there. Lasting and dry, it was an experience.
Oily black appearance with very little head.  Weak body.  Alcoholic flavor, malty sweetness and a citrusy smell.  Chocolate and coffee are the primary flavors.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar. Dark brown beer with a light brownish frothy head. Aroma is roasted malts with notes of dark fruits, light chocolate, coffee and grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet, well balanced roasted malts and quite bitter hops with floral and citrussy notes. Medium body, delicious creamy texture and a dry, bitter finish makes this a very good, delicate, subtle and refreshing porter.

Chopp. Black colour, light brown head, small. Pleasant aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee too. Good filling mouthfeel. Flavour is quite pleasant with good roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and some dark fruit. Roasty malty chocolate finish. Nice indeed. .

Tap @ le Mikkeller bar, pours dark brown ruby, with an espresso like head, nice lacings, Aroma: coffee, roasted, cardboard, chocolate, molasses , salty, savoury, earthy, a bit farty, some wooden notes, Light sour and fruity notes, goat cheese, medium mouthfeel, Taste:  Hard roasted, roasted bitterness, chocolate, sweetness, caramel malty, cardboard, peach, grassy fruit notes, Coffee, slight ashy, light acidic notes, apple. bitter endnotes

On tap. Pours a cloudy opaque dark brown with a small beige head. Interesting aroma of overripe fruit - and perhaps a little port. Medium body, a little subtle roastiness, a light touch of wood and a fairly solid hoppy finish. A different and refined Porter. 310112

Draft. A murky dark brown beer with thin dark brown head. The aroma has notes of rye, chocolate, malt, a bit of alcohol. The flavor is sweet and acidic with notes of chocolate, spices, malt, and rye, leading to a dry and slightly tart finish.
UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 Bottle. Aroma is lovely fruity hops with a smooth liquorice roast goodness. Wow. Flavour is medium bitter, quite dry and roasty. Nice hop note. Awesome stuff.
Bottle at home 28th January 2011. Aroma is smoky, coffee and chocolate orange. Perfect carbo as normal, tasty beer, chocolate, orange pithe and biscuit. Good beer

Bottle. Very dark brown, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty - faint oat and sweetish aroma, some coffee and roasted malt - light chocolate, citrus - grapefruit hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty - faint oat and lightly sweetish flavor, some coffee and roasted malt, faint chocolate, citrus - piney hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty - faint oat and lightly sweetish, some  roasted malt and some coffee, piney hoppyness. Lightly sweetish porter - really nice hoppyness/not too much coffee.
Dark brown with roast barley and pine hop nose. Rich roasted body, chocolate, smooth.

Bottle.  Black beer with a reasonable head.  The aroma is strongly roasted and bitter, and the flavour is deeply roasted with a black coffee, mildly malty and bitter finish.  Overall a very nice beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Stirchley Wines, Birmingham. A rich and bitter porter, with some crusty hoppiness in the middle and a long, dry finish. Smooth in mouth. Choc in the aftertaste. Very good.

33cl from DeMolen biershop.
Brune, col fin beige.
Arôme de houblon léger qui se mélange bien avec le bouquet de malt grillé/caramel.
En bouche, malt léger grillé sur la limite du torréfié, le tout sur un houblon qui se marie parfaitement au malt, laissant une très fine note amer le tout présentant un beau profile citronné. Le tout est sec et grillé avec un aspect choco/caramel et café des plus agréable.

Dark brown with ruby highlights. Big khaki head, long-lasting, lacing left behind. Big roasted barley aroma.  A slight sourness in the nose. Tastes of malt, caramel, vanilla, and coffee. Medium-bodied with a slight bitterness in the aftertaste. Not bad.

Bottle at Cafe Oto. Black coloured with creamy beige head. Aroma is bit of milky coffee, sweet roasty malt. Taste has coffee bitterness, dark chocolate and vinous dark fruit. Finish is quite creamy with a touch of bitterness.

Bottle, Beer Ritz, Leeds. Deep dark brown pour with a fair sized tan head. Prominent dark chocolate, roasted malts and pungent hops in the nose. The taste comprised the same elements, alongside some dark fruit and coffee notes. Dried out towards the finish. Tasty and classy as ever from the Kernel.

Bottle direct from The Kernel Brewery. Pours murky very very dark brown with a nice creamy (texture and colour) head. Nose is balance of citrous zingy hops, chocolate and coffee, with some hop pine too. Taste is chocolate, coffee and a finish that balances hop citrous and pine with roasted bitterness. Quite a strong flavoured porter. Basically a porter which has The Kernels India Pale Ale character bursting to get out.
Bottle 500ml.  Pours dark brown/black. Aroma roasted coffee/malts, some chocolate. Malty taste. Not Bad.

Bottle bought at the brewery.
Very dark brown. Smoke, nice bitterness, pepper. Light body. Coffee, burned toast.

Bottle shared by KnutAlbert. Opaque very dark brown body. Low, dense tanned head. American style hops reminiscent of resin, grapefruit and tropical fruits up front.  Then a whiff of mild roast and dark chocolate. Taste is dry chalky dark malts. Coffee bitterness, chocolate and a solid hop bitterness to the very end. Light to medium full. Roasty and hoppy finish. A pretty good one.

Bottle @ ZZT11 #2: Thanks to DutchDrebus:
Small airy off white head on top of a black beer with a ruby shine.
Smell burned wood and burned coffee.
Taste burned/roasted malts wood and coffee, herbs, grass and some spices.
Light coffee roasted malt herby aftertaste.
Low carbo, medium body, watery mouthfeel and texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle thanks to Dutchdrebus at Zieke Zuiden Tasting II. Very dark brown color with a nice dark red glow coming through. No head. Smell smoke, ash, coffee and roasted malts. Taste smoke, lightly bitter, coffee, roastyness. Long bitter, smokey finish. Low body, watery texture, low carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2011 Draught at CASK Pub & Kitchen Pre-GBBF Meet the Brewer event (with Apollo hops, 6.3 %). Opaque dark brown color. Dark chocolate is on top with leather, nuts and coffee. Fair amount of bitterness with citrusy and peppery hops. Full body. Nice porter. Less hops and more drinkability would make this even better.

lovely brew.
really black. dark tan head, receded quickly.
smells of passion fruit/coffee.  taste adds a little smoky ash and a touch of chocolate.
dry bitter finish.

Kegged new version on Columbus hops. Brown with a small off-white head. Fruity orange and tangerine aroma with caramel, chocolate and coffee notes. Malty flavour with fruity citrus notes, roast malt, chocolate and coffee notes and a hoppy bitter finish. 3.6

Kegged old version on Apollo hops. Strong caramel and toffee aroma with nuts and a touch of coffee. Sweetish malty flavour dominated by toffee, with a bit of creamed and sweetened coffee character. 3.5

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning, ABV 5.9%. Almost black, light beige head. Aroma of lovely hard roasted malts and chocolate, light grassy hops. Flavour is spruce, pine, hard roasted malts, bitter chocolate, chicory, bitter roasted and spruce hoppy finish. Light to medium bodied, soft mouthfeel. Really good.

Bottel from Kris Wines. Very dark thick black colour with strong off-white head. Aromas of roasted coffee, chocolate. Palate slightly unusual - so dark looks like should be a stout but as a porter thinner and less oily, with a hint of some unusual sherbety fizz. Full flavour with some sweetness then a long bitter finish. Good stuff.
50cl, at 6.3%Vol, new exclusive English brew Anno 2011, from The Bottle Shop Canterbury, complex Porter, malty/roasted and slightly spicy/bitter, not balanced, cloudy, rocky head, good brew

Bottle 50 cl, The Kernel Brewery. Pours dark brown with a small tanned head leaving lace. Aroma is ashy, acidy, roasted, meaty, woody and malty. Flavor is dry, acidy, ashy, bitter, roasted, slight fruity, miss some sweetness. Finishes dry and bitter.

Bottle [330ml] shared with HogTownHarry & garthicus -- c/o HogTownHarry. Pours a very dark brown, almost black, quite bubbly and with an average size semi-lasting frothy beige head. Aroma of coffee first followed by some smoke, cigarette butts, dark chocolate and dark fruit. Flavour of roasted malt, ash, smoke, dark chocolate and hops. Medium bodied. Pretty different, not great, just good.

330ml bottle at 6.0%.  Pours a very dark brown with a large frothy head.  Aroma is tar and fudge with piney hops underneath.  Taste has some grapefruit to start.  Tarry finish with more piney and grapefruit hops.

Bottle from The Kernel Brewery, thanks Sev! Pours a very dark brown colour with a thick tan head. Lovely aroma of passion-fruit, pine and espresso coffee. Similar roasted barley and espresso coffee flavours with a juicy pineapple and passion fruit hop quality. Nice dry finish with lingering coffee and caramel flavours. Moderate carbonation and a little CO2 prickle. A very nice beer indeed.
Bottle, pours a nice black, one of the best beers I have had. It just had such a good chocolate taste and it is not bitter much and it is so refined. I really enjoyed this one a lot. Very very good

Bottle bought @ Kris Wines, London. Pours murky brown with a cola-like head. The aroma is really pleasant with roasted malts, honey, liquorice, cocoa beans, a small hint of smoke, and some of the burned, sourish rye-bread components of a traditional English porter. A small hint of hops, also. Taste is very pleasant. Roasted malts, sourish maltiness, coffee, cocoa, liquorice. A lingering bitterness in the mouth, too. The carbonation start very high, but as it settles, it becomes more drinkable and even more enjoyable. One again, The Kernel doesnt disappoint.

Thanks to HogTownHarry. Appearance: Very dark brown with a small creamy brown head. Aroma: Dry, cigar smoke (not in a bad way) bran, sweet, malty too. Flavour: chocolate, quite a milky mouthfeel, coffee, lots of bitterness, spicy and a decent long cocoa finish   

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle shared with blankboy and garthicus.  Deep reddish-brown, average frothy beige head.  Incredibly dry aroma - roast nutshell malt, tons of dry resin bitterness.  Taste follows, more acidic, not as roasty or bitter, mild alcohol.  Slick, astringent mouthfeel, mild carbonation, very long bitter, coffee ground sourness.  Interesting take.
At the brewery in London august 2011. Black beer with a medium brown head. Smokey, cooffee and dark chocolate aroma. Cooffe, chocolate, licorice and some metallish taste.
Bottle from the brewery. Poured dark brown with large tan head. Very roasty and extremely well balanced. Not a lot of hops come through. Excellent porter.

bottle, beermerchants.com. Very fresh grassy hops and coffee combine for a great spicy aroma, that develops into a rich chocolate flavour on the tongue. Some smoke and leather develps, theres a slight mustiness hinted at too. Good lasting finish, brings in some cough mixture, giving a bit of alcoholic heat. Becomes much smoother towards the end.

Half on keg at CP&K, Meet the Brewer event, pre-festival night. Shiny black surface to a deep, dark coloured body. Dark malty fruits to the nose. Bittersweet chocolate in flavour including cocoa, bit of pine and modest hints of yeast. Rounded bittersweet finish. Pleasing (London, 01.08.2011).

Cask at Cask Pub & Kitchen @ Pre-GBBF Kernel night. Black - offwhite head. Licorice, fruity, bitterness, berries, dry bitterness, dry burned malts, coffee, grassy, light piney, nutty. Nice....ReRate: Bottle at Oyster & Porter House. Black - offwhite head. Burned malts. Fruity. Light body. Nice hoppy. Licorice. Coffee. Nice malty. Dry burned. Very pleasant.

Bottle at the brewery.
Black coloured with a small beige head.
Fruity and roasted aroma of liquorice, dark chocolate, hops and pine needles.
Roasted and hoppy flavour of dark chocolate, pine needles and grape fruits.
Dry hoppy finish.

Keg at CPK, Kernel event. Columbus hop version. Spicy citrus nose, with chocolate and coffee.
Nice balance, with orange chocolate, coffee, peppery, citrus, nice.

Cask @ pre GBBF 2011. A black colored beer, with a white head. The aroma of bitter hops with roasted malts.. The taste of chocolate, some fruit and hops. The aftertaste is bitter with some sweet fruits.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 Bottle at omhpers tasting 130817. Black beer with a nice lasting beige head. Roasted chocolate aroma, lots of cocoa powder, licorice, coffee notes, hay, grass, raisins, woody, soot, cigarettes, peat, floral notes. Roasted coffee flavor, hay, dark chocolate, caramel, soot, hay, floral notes, nice bitterness. Nice hoppy roasted coffee finish.  

Old rating: 3.7. Bottle at the brewery. Black beer, small brown head. Malty, salty licorice aroma, cocoa and metal notes. Bitter hop flavor, grassy, metal, roasted, cocoa, dark choclate. Bitter chocolate finish.
Bottle at the brewery. Dark brown, brown edge head. Aroma of milk chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate and coffee. Not bad.
33 cL bottle at the brewery. Fruity, dark malty and roasted. Bitter, fruity, dark malty and dense breadish. Bitter, fruity and rather dr finish with a persisting dark malt flavoured.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 330ml bottles from Beermerchants.com & Ales by Mail. Almost black with a big beige foamy head. Strong toasted coffee chocolate aroma & flavour. Bitter coffee aftertaste. A really good porter.

Trade with Fonefan, thanks Jan! Its black with a red hue and a huge, creamy head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, licorice, bitter chocolate and light coffee. The flavour is moderately sweet with notes of spruce, roasted malt, coffee, and the finish is dry and slightly bitter. A really nice porter without too much alcohol.
Bottle.  Dark brown pour with a white head.   Mocha and brett on the nose.  All kinds of carbonation.  Possible infection??  Mocha, dark roasted malt, funk, and a little sourness.

Bottle Cloudy brown with a small, creamy, off-white head. Aromatically, all Im really picking up here is fudge. Nice, but far too subtle. Medium-bodied with nearly expired carbonation. The flavor is just bland  lightly tangy with a mild cocoa powder component. Finishes lightly tangy and watery. I was told this was The Kernels take on New Glarus Unplugged Old English Porter. Ummm nope! Not my thing, but I appreciate the opportunity to try it. Bottle courtesy of 50belair!

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2011 Bottled (from the Kernel, London). Deep amber colour, small off-white head. Aroma is leather earth, some mild smoked notes and some roasted notes. Some floral and fruity notes as well. Horrible mix. Flavour is roasted malts, toasted notes, toffee and mild yeasty notes.  6 3 6 3 12

Bottle.  Dark brown with a large beige foam.  Aromas are coffee and chocolate with liquorice.  Spicy with cookie dough and peat smokiness.  Background caramel with herbal notes. Explosive gusher. Medium beige head, at least after weve been cleaning for half an hour. Muddy deep dull brown body with floaties. Strong resiny wooden lacquer aroma with spicy orange notes, as well as some earth. Dry-sweet roasty oranges and earth taste. Mid-bodied. Flat, dull mouthfeel, unsurprisingly. Dry-sweet roasty burnt popcorn aftertaste with fruity notes. Probably quite good when not so damned flat. (0.33l bottle, beermerchants.com.)

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty hoppy aroma with weak smoke hints. Roasted malty chocolate flavor with hoppy hints. Has a roasted malty hoppy bitter chocolate finish.

Bottled @ tasting cgarvieuk, courtesy of BeerCast_Rich. Dark brown colour, medium fluffy beige head. Aroma is dusty, coffee, followed by some citric hops. Quite odd. Flavour is light coffee and roasted malts, light hoppy. Smooth and creamy finish. Good stuff.

[330ml bottle, The Bottle Shop, Canterbury] Black pour as one would expect, fluffy white head. Hops on the aroma, plus bitter roasted malt. Porter flavours are the ones that predominate  there are hops going on, but mostly dark malt flavours. Chocolate rather than coffee  surprisingly not much alcohol on the palate. Another great Kernel beer [08052011]

7 May 2011, bottle at one of cgarvieuks legendary tastings. med/dark brown, thin brown lacing. i really like this nose. big coffee, and only coffee, but not huge coffee, and for some reason i really like it. hops come out on the nose after a bit. thin/med body and very fizzy. loads of astringent coffee. very tart for some reason. very nice

Bottle; bought @ brewery consumed at home.


Had to have an aggresisive pour with this one as the content exploded a little out of the glass. No big gusher but the first time Ive had a Kernel beer gush a little. Poured into La Choffe glass. Good mocha lacing, really nice opaque black appearance. 

Aroma is full on roasted malts, coffee; spices, typiical high present hop-aroma from Evin, chocolate, liquorish, leather and smoke.

Taste is silky velvet; leather, berries, roasted malt, liqourish, burnt toast, ask, tobacco, a hidden citirc hop bite, orange peel, hazelnuts and those big nuts you get for Christmas whcih I cant reemmber!

Fantastic stuff and something which could be laid down for some time.

Bottle from the Brewery. Pours dark brown with a light tan head. Chocolate, coffee, caramel and some dark fruit aromas. Coffee, caramel and chocolate flavours with a bit of a herb scene going on in the background. Smoky-dry and light bitter finish. Pleasant.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2011 Shared bottle at BrewDog Edinburgh. Dark brown, medium light tan head. Classic (and necessary) fruity, burnt tanginess on the front. Coffee grounds, subtle vegetable aroma. Very faint chocolate. Taste of toasted malts, nice herbal hops. A really great porter.

Dark brown-ruby, almost opaque color, thick creamy brown head, lace. Hayish hoppyness over some toasted maltyness in the flavor. Medium-bodied. Cold coffee, fruity hoppyness mixed with roasted malts. A bit thin finish. Nice, not very British!

A Mes rate. Bottle at The Kernel.Thanks have to go out to Evin for making sure I tried this. My god its good. The aroma is a barrage of chocolate and grassy hops. It shouldnt work but by jingo old chap, I think its a beauty. Phenominally good in fact. There is a glorious herbal note that just sits so well. Almost fennel, almost rosemary, so noseable. Not quite so good in the mouth but its still very tasty. Slight hop resin, really good roast coffee notes. Lengthy fresh malt and chocolate finish. Just bloody excellent all round.
